intro: Hypochaeris runcinata, commonly known as the common mouse-ear chickweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with small, spoon-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Hypochaeris runcinata is an annual or biennial plant that produces numerous seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution.
